abstract: A method may include selecting a particular entity from a knowledge graph when a level of connectivity between entities in the knowledge graph that are neighbors to the particular entity is above a certain level and determining whether the particular entity is in a character string.
summary: <SOH> BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE DRAWINGS <EOH>FIG. 1 is an example of a portion of a knowledge graph. FIG. 2 is flowchart of an example of a method. FIG. 3 is a simplified example of a portion of a knowledge graph. FIG. 4 is a block diagram that illustrates an example of a computer. FIG. 5 is a block diagram of an example of machine-readable storage. detailed-description description="Detailed Description" end="lead"?
title: SELECTING AN ENTITY FROM A KNOWLEDGE GRAPH WHEN A LEVEL OF CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN ITS NEIGHBORS IS ABOVE A CERTAIN LEVEL
